00024 class KHLaMCEvent : public KEvent {         
00025         
00026 public:
00027         //Constructors and destructor. Only Derived class and the Factory
00028         //SHOULD access these methods. 
00029         //However, in order for ROOT's I/O to work properly
00030         //the constructor and destructor
00031         //have to be public. Otherwise, I would have made them protected or private
00032         KHLaMCEvent(void);
00033         KHLaMCEvent(const KHLaMCEvent &anEvent);
00034         virtual ~KHLaMCEvent(void);
00035         KHLaMCEvent& operator=(const KHLaMCEvent &anEvent);
00036         KHLaMCEvent& operator=(const KEvent &anEvent);
00037         virtual void Clear(Option_t *opt = "C");
00038         Bool_t IsSame(const KHLaMCEvent &anEvent, Bool_t bPrint = false) const;
00039         Bool_t operator==(const KHLaMCEvent &anEvent) const { return IsSame(anEvent,false); }
00040         Bool_t operator!=(const KHLaMCEvent &anEvent) const { return !(*this==anEvent); }
00041         
00042         Int_t GetNumBolos(void) const {return fNumBolo;}
00043 
00044         void SetNumBolo(Int_t aNum){fNumBolo = aNum;}
00045         
00046         KMCSingleBoloSubRecord* GetBolo(Int_t i) const;
00047         
00048         TClonesArray* GetBoloSubRecords(void) const {return fBolo;}
00049         
00050         KMCSingleBoloSubRecord* AddBolo();
00051         
00052         
00053         
00054 private: 
00055         Int_t fNumBolo;  //the number of KMCSingleBoloSubRecord in this event. 
00056         
00057         TClonesArray *fBolo; //->  pointer to an array of KMCSingleBoloSubRecord found in this event.
00058         
00059         template<class T> T* AddSubRecord(TClonesArray *mArray, Int_t &mCount);
